service.name: Claim Tax Benefits
start.banner.1: The Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) sent you a letter about the new
start.banner.3: You need information on that letter to file your 2018 taxes with this service.
start.p1: You may be able to use this service if Ontario was your home province on December 31, 2018. Your income for the 2018 tax year must be under $35,000, and:
start.li1: Come from your employment, pension, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP), or benefits such as social assistance.
start.li2: May include up to $1,000 of interest income. The interest must come from Canadian sources, such as a bank or savings account.
start.li3: Can’t come from your own business or self-employment.
start.li4.1: Personal filing code. You can find this code in the CRA letter about this new

You can find your SIN on your tax return: You can find your SIN on your tax return or other correspondence from Service Canada. Service Canada also gave you a card or confirmation letter with your SIN.

Your taxes may be lower if you gave mone: Your taxes may be lower if you gave money to an election campaign or political party. You will need an official contribution receipt from the candidate or political party.

Your taxes may be lower if you gave mone: Your taxes may be lower if you gave money to a charity or similar organization. You will need an official tax receipt. The charity or organization must be registered with the government to give the receipt. You can enter any donations from the last five that you didn't already deduct from your taxes.

You can file your taxes even if you can’: You can file your taxes even if you can’t answer any security questions. Other free and secure ways to file are:
By mail, using the form sent with the CR: By mail, using the form sent with the CRA
At a tax clinic, where you can get help: At a tax clinic, where you can get help to file. Visit canada.ca/taxes-help to find your nearest clinic.

For income tax, you become a resident by: For income tax, you become a resident by building strong ties to Canada as your home. Usually this happens on the date you arrive in Canada.

Your taxes may be lower if your provinci: Your taxes may be lower if your provincial health plan, work or private insurance didn’t cover all your medical costs or expenses.

You may be able to enter medical costs f: You may be able to enter medical costs for yourself and your children. You may also be able to enter costs for your partner by marriage or common-law, and their children.
To include a child’s medical costs, the: To include a child’s medical costs, the child must have been under 18 on December 31, 2018, and:
Depended on you for support for example,: Depended on you for support for example, with food, shelter, clothing
You or your partner must have had sole c: You or your partner must have had sole custody of the child
You may still be able to claim a child’s: You may still be able to claim a child’s medical expenses, even if you or your partner didn’t have sole custody. Contact CRA at,

You may live in a long-term care home or: You may live in a long-term care home or facility if costs such as nursing or personal support are combined with your rent. The home must be public or non-profit. This means that a charity, city, First Nations, or similar organization manages the home.

You live in a small and rural community: You live in a small and rural community if you don’t live in:
Ottawa, Kingston, Belleville, Peterborou: Ottawa, Kingston, Belleville, Peterborough, Oshawa, Toronto, Hamilton, St. Catharines-Niagara, Kitchener-Cambridge-Waterloo, Brantford, Guelph, London, Windsor, Barrie, Sudbury, or Thunder Bay.

The Climate Action Incentive (CAI) lower: The Climate Action Incentive (CAI) lowers the amount of tax you pay. And you may get money back from the CAI.
Your CAI is greater if you live in a sma: Your CAI is greater if you live in a small and rural community.
